intro: Reseda lutea subsp. neglecta, commonly known as yellow weed or lesser reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in loose clusters, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often branched and somewhat hairy. This species is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and fields, and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
